Description: Handle-plate fragment of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater with part of rim; interior: glazed; on top of handle black-figure decoration consisting of youth's face with added red on skin, to left; below, black band; on rim, rays; edges of rim and underside glazed black.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 40, pl. XX, no. 26)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 271, no. B211)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0950)
